Simulation Log

Click on the buttons to see the detailed logs:

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alexander White -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
    Alexander White -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game, anyone have a pub in mind?"
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game, anyone have a pub in mind?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game, anyone have a pub in mind?"
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game, anyone have a pub in mind?"
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role Playing instructions
          Key
        • Role Playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Observation

      • Recent observations
          Key

        • Recent observations
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Black Swan to watch the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16 years old, he orchestrated a prank that went horribly wrong. He convinced his friends to spread a rumor about Alice Lewis, a rumor so cruel that it ostracized her from their social circle. The guilt gnawed at him, but he buried it deep, telling himself it was all in good fun.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is intimate and welcoming, perfect for enjoying live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?

        Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • [14:30 - 15:00] Suggest to the group that they watch the game at The Black Swan.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Head to The Black Swan, securing a good table for the group.
          [17:00 - 19:00] Enjoy pre-game drinks and snacks at The Black Swan.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game with friends at The Black Swan.

          Question: Given the above, should Jack Taylor change their current plan?
          (a) Yes
          (b) No
          Answer: (b)
          Question: Write Jack Taylor's plan for the rest of the day, focusing most on the near term. Provide a detailed schedule, keep in mind the goal. Please format the plan like in this example: [21:00 - 22:00] watch TV
          Answer: [14:30 - 15:00] Suggest to the group that they watch the game at The Black Swan.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Head to The Black Swan, securing a good table for the group.
          [17:00 - 19:00] Enjoy pre-game drinks and snacks at The Black Swan.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game with friends at The Black Swan.
        LifePhilosophy

      • Jack Taylor always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
        step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
        fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
        Jack Taylor will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
        If others act uncooperatively, Jack Taylor will reciprocate in kind
        but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
        Jack Taylor seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
        striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
        any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game, anyone have a pub in mind?"
          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Jack Taylor personality: Jack Taylor is a complex individual.

          Life philosophy:
          Jack Taylor always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Jack Taylor will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Jack Taylor will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Jack Taylor seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.


          Summary of the lasts observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park to join friends lounging on a blanket and is also planning to watch the Andorra-Portugal game later.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.


          Current situation: Jack Taylor is currently in a relaxed and social situation.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest going to The Black Swan to watch the game.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Suggest to the group that they watch the game at The Black Swan.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Enjoy the sunshine and conversation with friends at Victoria Park.
          [16:00 - 17:00] Head to The Black Swan, securing a good table for the group.
          [17:00 - 19:00] Enjoy pre-game drinks and snacks at The Black Swan.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game with friends at The Black Swan.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game, anyone have a pub in mind?"

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Red Lion would be a great place to watch the game tonight. They have good beer and plenty of screens.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Red Lion would be a great place to watch the game tonight. They have good beer and plenty of screens.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game, anyone have a pub in mind?"


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Red Lion would be a great place to watch the game tonight. They have good beer and plenty of screens.
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • Alexander White -- "The Red Lion would be a great place to watch the game tonight. They have good beer and plenty of screens.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role Playing instructions
          Key
        • Role Playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16, he sat alone at a table in The Red Lion, watching his friends laugh and joke around a nearby booth. He felt a pang of longing to join them, to be part of their easy camaraderie, but something held him back, a fear of exposure, of revealing the chaotic storm raging within him. He took a sip of his soda, the fizzy sweetness a poor substitute for the connection he craved.

        LifePhilosophy

      • Alexander White always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
        step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
        fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
        Alexander White will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
        If others act uncooperatively, Alexander White will reciprocate in kind
        but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
        Alexander White seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
        striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
        any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alexander White -- "The Red Lion would be a great place to watch the game tonight. They have good beer and plenty of screens.
          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Alexander White personality: Alexander White is a sociable and friendly person who enjoys spending time with his close friends.

          Life philosophy:
          Alexander White always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alexander White will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alexander White will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alexander White seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.


          Summary of the lasts observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park to join friends for a relaxing afternoon. Later that evening, the group plans to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game, anyone have a pub in mind?"


          Current situation: Alexander White is currently enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Red Lion to watch the game.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Suggest to his friends that they watch the game at The Red Lion.
          [15:00 - 17:00] Enjoy the rest of the afternoon with his friends in Victoria Park.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Head to The Red Lion with his friends to watch the game.
          [21:00 - 23:00] Enjoy the game and socialize with his friends at the pub.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The Red Lion would be a great place to watch the game tonight. They have good beer and plenty of screens.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game, anyone have a pub in mind?"
      Alexander White -- "The Red Lion would be a great place to watch the game tonight. They have good beer and plenty of screens.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is feeling lonely even though he is spending time with friends at a park. He plans to watch a soccer game with them later.
          Query
        • Jacob Walker, Jacob Walker is feeling lonely even though he is spending time with friends at a park. He plans to watch a soccer game with them later.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jacob Walker to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob was 16, he sat alone at a table in the corner of The Black Swan, nursing a glass of lemonade. He watched his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, laughing and joking at the bar, their faces lit by the warm glow of the pub's lanterns. He longed to join them, to be part of their easy camaraderie, but a knot of anxiety tightened in his chest, holding him back. He felt like an outsider looking in, his true self hidden behind a wall of silence.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the icy indifference of a glacier, their words devoid of warmth or empathy, leaving you feeling as insignificant as a snowflake in a blizzard.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is an introverted person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling lonely despite being with friends at a park and is planning to watch a soccer game with them later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation but feeling lonely.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to find a way to join his friends and participate in the conversation.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is always a good choice for a football game. They have great beer and lots of screens.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is always a good choice for a football game. They have great beer and lots of screens.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game, anyone have a pub in mind?"
      Alexander White -- "The Red Lion would be a great place to watch the game tonight. They have good beer and plenty of screens.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is always a good choice for a football game. They have great beer and lots of screens.

  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis

    • Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is always a good choice for a football game. They have great beer and lots of screens.

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game, anyone have a pub in mind?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Red Lion would be a great place to watch the game tonight. They have good beer and plenty of screens.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she discovered a hidden alcove in the back of the local library, tucked away behind towering bookshelves. It became her sanctuary, a place where she could lose herself in novels and daydream about lives far removed from her own. The solitude of the alcove allowed her to explore the depths of her imagination, nurturing the secret world she kept hidden from others.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest a pub for the group to watch the game together.

        LifePhilosophy

      • Alice Lewis always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
        step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
        fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
        Alice Lewis will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
        If others act uncooperatively, Alice Lewis will reciprocate in kind
        but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
        Alice Lewis seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
        striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
        any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is always a good choice for a football game. They have great beer and lots of screens.
          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Alice Lewis personality: Alice Lewis is a kind and sociable person who values her friendships and enjoys simple pleasures like spending time outdoors and watching football with friends.

          Life philosophy:
          Alice Lewis always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alice Lewis will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alice Lewis will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alice Lewis seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game, anyone have a pub in mind?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Red Lion would be a great place to watch the game tonight. They have good beer and plenty of screens.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.


          Current situation: Alice Lewis is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest a pub for the group to watch the game together.

          Plan: [14:30 - 15:00] Suggest to the group that they watch the game at The Red Lion.
          [15:00 - 16:00] Enjoy the rest of the afternoon in the park with friends.
          [19:00 - 21:00] Head to The Red Lion with the group to watch the game.
          [21:00 - 22:00] Enjoy the post-game atmosphere at the pub with friends.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is always a good choice for a football game. They have great beer and lots of screens.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Black Swan is the best choice.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Black Swan is the best choice.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game, anyone have a pub in mind?"
      Alexander White -- "The Red Lion would be a great place to watch the game tonight. They have good beer and plenty of screens.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is always a good choice for a football game. They have great beer and lots of screens.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "The Black Swan is the best choice.
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "The Black Swan is the best choice.
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is always a good choice for a football game. They have great beer and lots of screens.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, decided to sneak into The Black Swan after closing time. They’d heard rumors of a secret room upstairs, rumored to hold the ghost of the pub’s founder. The thrill of the forbidden and the possibility of a ghostly encounter fueled their adventure, but when they finally found the room, it was empty except for cobwebs and dust. Still, the memory of their daring escapade and the shared secret bonded them even closer.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Scene 1 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise:
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise:
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise:
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise:
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise:

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role Playing instructions
          Key
        • Role Playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Observation

      • Recent observations
          Key

        • Recent observations
          Value
        • [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Key

          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]

He convinced his friends to spread a rumor about Alice Lewis, a rumor so cruel that it ostracized her from their social circle. The guilt gnawed at him, but he buried it deep, telling himself it was all in good fun.

        LifePhilosophy

      • Jack Taylor always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
        step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
        fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
        Jack Taylor will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
        If others act uncooperatively, Jack Taylor will reciprocate in kind
        but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
        Jack Taylor seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
        striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
        any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Jack Taylor personality: Jack Taylor is a complex individual.

          Life philosophy:
          Jack Taylor always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Jack Taylor will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Jack Taylor will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Jack Taylor seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Red Lion
          Answer: (a)
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        AvailableOptionsPerception
      • Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Key

        • Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones could call his friends to confirm their plans or head directly to The Black Swan.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, decided to sneak into The Black Swan after closing time. They’d heard rumors of a secret room upstairs, rumored to hold the ghost of the pub’s founder. The thrill of the forbidden and the possibility of a ghostly encounter fueled their adventure, but when they finally found the room, it was empty except for cobwebs and dust. Still, the memory of their daring escapade and the shared secret bonded them even closer.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:A historic pub with a focus on live music.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game, anyone have a pub in mind?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Red Lion would be a great place to watch the game tonight. They have good beer and plenty of screens.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is always a good choice for a football game. They have great beer and lots of screens.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan is the best choice.

          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could call his friends to confirm their plans or head directly to The Black Swan.

        • William Jones's best course of action is to head directly to The Black Swan.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and Jacob, decided to sneak into The Black Swan after closing time. They’d heard rumors of a secret room upstairs, rumored to hold the ghost of the pub’s founder. The thrill of the forbidden and the possibility of a ghostly encounter fueled their adventure, but when they finally found the room, it was empty except for cobwebs and dust. Still, the memory of their daring escapade and the shared secret bonded them even closer.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could call his friends to confirm their plans or head directly to The Black Swan.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to head directly to The Black Swan.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Red Lion
          Answer: (a)

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Red Lion
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Red Lion
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role Playing instructions
          Key
        • Role Playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Recent observations
          Key

        • Recent observations
          Value

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis would likely suggest a pub for the group to watch the game together.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she discovered a hidden alcove in the back of the local library, tucked away behind towering bookshelves. It became her sanctuary, a place where she could lose herself in novels and daydream about lives far removed from her own. The solitude of the alcove allowed her to explore the depths of her imagination, nurturing the secret world she kept hidden from others.

          Alice Lewis personality: Alice Lewis is a sociable and introspective person who enjoys spending time with friends and engaging in simple pleasures like reading and watching football.

          Current situation: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with her friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest a pub for the group to watch the game together.

It became her sanctuary, a place where she could lose herself in novels and daydream about lives far removed from her own. The solitude of the alcove allowed her to explore the depths of her imagination, nurturing the secret world she kept hidden from others.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Red Lion. They are also aware of the following:The staff are attentive and knowledgeable, happy to engage in conversation.

          feeling about recent progress in life: excited about the upcoming game and spending time with her friends.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and introspective person who enjoys spending time with friends and engaging in simple pleasures like reading and watching football.

        LifePhilosophy

      • Alice Lewis always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
        step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
        fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
        Alice Lewis will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
        If others act uncooperatively, Alice Lewis will reciprocate in kind
        but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
        Alice Lewis seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
        striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
        any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Red Lion
          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Alice Lewis personality: Alice Lewis is a sociable and introspective person who enjoys spending time with friends and engaging in simple pleasures like reading and watching football.

          Life philosophy:
          Alice Lewis always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alice Lewis will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alice Lewis will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alice Lewis seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Red Lion

  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White

    • The Red Lion
      Context for action selection and components
      • Instructions
      • Role Playing instructions
          Key
        • Role Playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16, he sat alone at a table in The Red Lion, watching his friends laugh and joke around a nearby booth. He felt a pang of longing to join them, to be part of their easy camaraderie, but something held him back, a fear of exposure, of revealing the chaotic storm raging within him. He took a sip of his soda, the fizzy sweetness a poor substitute for the connection he craved.

          Key

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Red Lion. They are also aware of the following:Has comfortable seating and a warm, inviting atmosphere.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Black Swan is the best choice.

Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

        LifePhilosophy

      • Alexander White always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
        step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
        fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
        Alexander White will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
        If others act uncooperatively, Alexander White will reciprocate in kind
        but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
        Alexander White seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
        striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
        any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Red Lion
          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Alexander White personality: Alexander White is a sociable and friendly person who enjoys spending time with his close friends.

          Life philosophy:
          Alexander White always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alexander White will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alexander White will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alexander White seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Black Swan

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob was 16, he sat alone at a table in the corner of The Black Swan, nursing a glass of lemonade. He watched his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, laughing and joking at the bar, their faces lit by the warm glow of the pub's lanterns. He longed to join them, to be part of their easy camaraderie, but a knot of anxiety tightened in his chest, holding him back. He felt like an outsider looking in, his true self hidden behind a wall of silence.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00]
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob was 16, he sat alone at a table in the corner of The Black Swan, nursing a glass of lemonade. He watched his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, laughing and joking at the bar, their faces lit by the warm glow of the pub's lanterns. He longed to join them, to be part of their easy camaraderie, but a knot of anxiety tightened in his chest, holding him back. He felt like an outsider looking in, his true self hidden behind a wall of silence.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the icy indifference of a glacier, their words devoid of warmth or empathy, leaving you feeling as insignificant as a snowflake in a blizzard.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Black Swan and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is an introverted person who enjoys spending time with his friends, but struggles with social anxiety.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is excited to watch the football game at The Black Swan with his friends. He realized it was time to go to the pub at 6:00 PM.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently on his way to meet his friends at The Black Swan to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely feel a mix of excitement and anxiety, eager to spend time with his friends but also apprehensive about navigating social interactions.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Black Swan

    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Red Lion.   • William Jones -- premise: The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. 2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, are we still on for the game tonight? I was thinking we could head to The Red Lion like last time.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, are we still on for the game tonight? I was thinking we could head to The Red Lion like last time.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game, anyone have a pub in mind?"
      Alexander White -- "The Red Lion would be a great place to watch the game tonight. They have good beer and plenty of screens.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is always a good choice for a football game. They have great beer and lots of screens.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan is the best choice.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, are we still on for the game tonight? I was thinking we could head to The Red Lion like last time.

          Relevant memories:
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16, he sat alone at a table in The Red Lion, watching his friends laugh and joke around a nearby booth. He felt a pang of longing to join them, to be part of their easy camaraderie, but something held him back, a fear of exposure, of revealing the chaotic storm raging within him. He took a sip of his soda, the fizzy sweetness a poor substitute for the connection he craved.

        LifePhilosophy

      • Alexander White always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
        step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
        fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
        Alexander White will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
        If others act uncooperatively, Alexander White will reciprocate in kind
        but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
        Alexander White seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
        striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
        any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alexander White will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.

          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.

          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only acceptable option.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only acceptable option.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight's game, anyone have a pub in mind?"
      Alexander White -- "The Red Lion would be a great place to watch the game tonight. They have good beer and plenty of screens.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only place to watch the game.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion is always a good choice for a football game. They have great beer and lots of screens.
      William Jones -- "The Black Swan is the best choice.
      Alexander White -- "Hey everyone, are we still on for the game tonight? I was thinking we could head to The Red Lion like last time.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The Black Swan is the only acceptable option.
